articles.title: Kim Jong Il congratulates KPA soldiers on Sun's Day
Floral basket from Palestinian President
articles.content:
Floral basket from Palestinian President
    Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- A floral basket from President of the State of Palestine Yasser Arafat was laid before the statue of the President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill in Pyongyang on the occasion of the latter's birth anniversary.   It was laid by Shaher Mohammed Abdlah,  Palestinian  Ambassador E.P. to Korea on April 15.   The basket had a ribbon bearing the letters "The great leader H.E. Kim Il Sung will always live."

Joint performance of Korean and foreign artistes
articles.content:
Joint performance of Korean and foreign artistes
   Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- A joint performance of Korean artistes and foreign participants in the 17th April Spring Friendship Art Festival was given here on Thursday, the birth anniversary of the President Kim Il Sung.   It was appreciated by Jang Chol, chairman of the festival organizing committee, and other officials, citizens, labor innovators, youth and students.    The program of the performance which began with the revolutionary paean "Song of General Kim Il Sung" included songs, dances and circuses.   Famous foreign music and acrobatic pieces were put on the stage by artistes from various countries.

articles.title: Participants in 17th spring festival feted
articles.content:
Participants in 17th spring festival feted 
   Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- The presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) of the DPRK gave receptions at the Okryu and Chongryu restaurants for the participants in the 17th April Spring Friendship Art Festival on April 15, the birth anniversary of the President Kim Il Sung.   Present on invitation were foreign delegations, delegates and artistes and overseas. Korean artistes, who are staying here for the festival.Present there were Ri Jong Ok and Pak Song Chol, Honorary vice-Presidents of the SPA presidium, and Jang Chol, chairman of the festival organizing committee and others.   Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Children's camps open
articles.content:
Children's camps open
    Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- Children's camps across the country opened on the occasion of the birth anniversary of the President Kim Il Sung.   Campers included children of officers of units of the Korean People's Army in the forefront, labor innovators in key fields of the national economy, scientists and technicians.   They will enjoy mountaineering, sports and amusement and art activities.The children received by the Mangyongdae Children's Camp, the Songdowon International Children's Camp, the Soak Children's  Camp and the Myohyangsan Children's Mountaineering Camp and other camps in different parts of the country enjoyed amusement and sports games to significantly spend the first camping day.

articles.title: Greetings to Syrian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Syrian President
   Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Syrian President Hafez al-Assad on Apr. 14 to mark the 53rd anniversary of the Syrian Independence.    The message says the Syrian people rallied close around the President  are working hard for the building of modern Syria and the fair and comprehensive solution of the Middle East issue.    It says the Korean people are following the just struggle of the Syrian people with deep attention and extend full  support and firm solidarity to the struggle.   It expresses the belief that the excellent friendly and cooperative relations and the bonds of traditional solidarity between the two countries will grow stronger in the joint struggle for independence against imperialism with each passing day.

articles.title: Banquet given for overseas Koreans
articles.content:
Banquet given for overseas Koreans
   Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- A banquet was arranged by General Secretary Kim Jong Il for the visiting overseas Koreans at the Mansudae Art Theatre on Thursday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of the President Kim Il Sung.Present at the banquet were vice-president Yang Hyong Sop of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and officials concerned.It was attended by the delegation of Japan-resident Koreans headed by So Man Sul, first vice-chairman of the central standing committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), president of the International Taekwon-do Federation Choe Hong Hui and his party and other overseas. Koreans.   Speeches were made at the banquet which were followed by an art performance by Pyongyang artistes.

articles.title: Homage paid to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Homage paid to Kim Il Sung
    Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- The diplomatic corps and military attaches corps here visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace to pay homage to the President Kim Il Sung on April 15, his birth anniversary.    Among the visitors were Vishwanath, secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council and director of the board of the International Institute of the Juche Idea (IIJI), Ogami Kenichi, secretary general of the IIJI, and their parties and other foreigners. Also among them were a delegation of Koreans in Japan headed by So Man Sul, first vice-chairman of the central standing committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, and other Koreans from abroad.   Pak Kwang Gi, chief of the Pyongyang mission of the National Democratic Front of South Korea, visited the palace.

articles.title: Floral baskets laid before statue of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Floral baskets laid before statue of Kim Il Sung
   Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- Floral baskets were laid by foreigners and overseas. Koreans before the statue of the President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill in Pyongyang on Thursday on the occasion of his birth anniversary.Among them were the members of the diplomatic and military attaches' corps in Korea, participants in the 17th April Spring Friendship Art Festival, staff members of the Chinese embassy in Korea, Pyongyang-resident Chinese, Pak Kwang Gi, chief of the Pyongyang mission of the National Democratic Front of South Korea, and delegations and groups of overseas Koreans on a visit to the homeland.Floral baskets and bouquets of flowers were also laid by Chinese consul-general Liu Zhijiang  and his staff members in Chongjin and members of the Russian consulate general in Chongjin before the statue of President Kim Il Sung in Korea's northern city of Chongjin on Thursday.

articles.title: Foreign delegations visit 1st Kimilsungia Show
articles.content:
Foreign delegations visit 1st Kimilsungia Show
    Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- Foreign political party delegations and delegates, who are on a visit to Korea to commemorate the birth anniversary of the President Kim Il Sung, visited the 1st Kimilsungia Show on Thursday.   Hearing an explanation about the immortal flower, they saw round the show with deep interest.

articles.title: Profound tribute to Kim Il Sung
CPRF slogans favored
Letter to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Il
   Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a letter from O Ik Je, vice-chairman of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland, on April 15, Sun's Day.   The letter describes Sun's Day as a joy and good fortune of national rebirth and a sacred day of history.   It says:   If a nation is to be a nation, it must have a genuine leader and realize independence, the life and soul of the nation. This has come true thanks to President Kim Il Sung.   His noble will and traces led to saving Korea and building an independent country.  His exploit shines all over the world under your guidance.    Kim Il Sung's Korea will remain an impregnable fortress for independence which will shine forever as a strong power.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il receives letter from Ri In Mo
Reception given to commemorate Sun's Day
Commemorations of Sun's Day
articles.content:
Commemorations of Sun's Day
   Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- Commemorations of Sun's Day, the birth anniversary of the President Kim Il Sung, took place in a grand style.   Youth and students here had an evening gala "Song of the Eternal Sun" at Kim Il Sung Square on Thursday.   Art performances were given at theatres, parks and pleasure grounds of the capital city drawing capacity audiences.    Schoolchildren gave art performances at the Pyongyang and Mangyongdae schoolchildren's palaces.   Youth vanguard from across the country met in Chongsan-ri, Nampho city, on Wednesday to pledge loyalty.Present were senior party and state officials Kim Yong Nam, Ri Jong Ok, Pak Song Chol and Paek Hak Rim and others.
